tweet: My thanks to @ChuckGrassley, @MarkWarner, @RepDonBeyer, and @RepWexton for their advocacy on behalf of the Ghaisars. Bijan’s family and the public deserve answers to the Park Police shooting that killed Bijan. We will continue to seek justice. https://www.washingtonpost.com/crime-law/2019/11/20/grassley-warner-demand-meeting-with-fbi-bijan-ghaisar-shooting-case/ …
My bill (H.R. 917) would allow DC to appoint its own prosecutor to increase transparency and DC’s ability to hold that prosecutor accountable.

I have repeatedly urged the US Attorney for DC to increase prosecutions for hate crimes against the LGBTQ community, with little response. This is more evidence that DC must have our own locally appointed prosecutor to protect DC residents.
I am a lead cosponsor of a resolution commemorating the Transgender Day of Remembrance in the House with @RepJoeKennedy and @RepDavids.
Today is #TransDayOfRemembrance. Sadly, @HRC estimates that at least 22 transgender & gender non-conforming people have been murdered this year, including DC residents Zoe Spears and Deeniquia Dodds.
Our 700,000 residents contribute the highest per capita federal taxes but are denied votes in Congress because they live in their nation’s capital. It's time for #DCstatehood.

Thank you to @civilrightsorg and the 150+ civil rights groups for including #DCstatehood in your voting rights reforms platform. https://civilrights.org/2019/11/14/more-than-150-civil-rights-groups-demand-comprehensive-voting-rights-reform/ …

Relieved that the Mazumdars have returned home to the nation’s capital. More evidence that Trump’s immigration policies are cruel and completely broken. A family living in the US for nearly two decades should never have been barred from coming home. https://www.washingtonpost.com/local/a-dc-family-stranded-in-india-by-a-broken-immigration-system-finally-returns-home/2019/11/18/fe221784-0a0c-11ea-8397-a955cd542d00_story.html …

In addition to requesting an internal Park Police investigation, @RepDonBeyer, @RepWexton and I have requested the FBI release the 911 calls relating to Bijan Ghaisar, who was killed by 2 Park Police officers. We will continue to demand justice. https://wtop.com/fairfax-county/2019/11/dc-va-reps-want-release-of-911-calls-in-fatal-park-police-shooting-of-bijan-ghaisar/ …

If it were not for local VA police with dashboard cameras, we might not know what happened. Beginning Nov 1, @RepDonBeyer and I have succeeded in getting a pilot program by DOJ to have federal officers work with local task forces who use body cameras.

I spoke this weekend at the 2-year commemoration of the death of Bijan Ghaisar, killed by Park Police. Last week, DOJ declined to pursue legal action. @RepDonBeyer, @RepWexton and I demanded an investigation by US Park Police to determine if the officers involved should be fired. pic.twitter.com/ME6xWsMIL5
Thank you to St. Peter School for hosting me today. We are proud of your designation as a National Blue Ribbon School, providing a great education for local students. pic.twitter.com/NMZQOKGfZA

Contract workers often do the same work as employees, yet have almost none of the same protections. I used my background as chair of the @USEEOC to introduce a bill that would apply our anti-discrimination laws to all contract workers. https://www.forbes.com/sites/patriciagbarnes/2019/11/13/proposed-federal-law-would-extend-protection-from-discrimination-to-independent-contractors/#5d38030744a5 …

Heard explosive testimony yesterday from witness who overheard Trump ask for dirt on BIDEN. Going this am to hear OMB career employee on hold on Ukraine funds.

Was Trump’s tweet while Ambassador Yovanovitch was testifying an impeachable offense of witness intimidation in real time?  I’m on my way to hear testimony of David Holmes, who heard Trump discuss investigation of Biden.

As chair of the House Highways and Transit Subcommittee, I’m writing scooters into the next surface transportation reauthorization bill to expand transportation options to reduce congestion and protect the climate. Thanks @MicroMoCo for pushing this important issue. pic.twitter.com/bnTXxfcZyU
My bill would permit marijuana use in such housing in states where marijuana is legal and end unequal treatment of low-income residents living in such housing.

Federal law prohibits marijuana use in federally assisted housing, even if marijuana is legal in that state. Erase the confusion. https://www.curbed.com/2019/11/13/20962970/marijuana-section-8-medical-pot-public-housing …

The Trump Administration is on a tear to undermine reproductive health care, while Congress bars DC from using local funds for abortions for low-income women. I’ll keep fighting until DC is no longer singled out. #HandsOffDC pic.twitter.com/kZhiCAuita

Thank you to the 18 national organizations for their work to keep Congress from interfering with DC’s efforts to commercialize recreational marijuana. We will never tolerate restrictions unique to DC. https://www.marijuanamoment.net/groups-push-congress-to-let-d-c-legalize-marijuana-sales/ …

For @TheBlackCaucus, I submitted our strongest opposition to Steven Menashi’s nomination to the U.S. Second Circuit Court of Appeals. He has devoted his career to attacking minorities, women, and the LGBTQ community. His record is disqualifying.
Going on the House floor shortly to warn Republicans that they will have a fight on their hands if they try to move federal agencies out of the nation’s capital.

This #VeteransDay, we honored our DC veterans at an event hosted by Veterans United for DC Statehood. Despite defending our democracy, DC vets still have only limited self-government and a limited vote on the House floor once they return home. They deserve #DCstatehood. pic.twitter.com/REAZXaatbJ

I’m leading a Special Order on the House floor tonight to speak on the injustice of Austin Tice, a DC resident who has been held for seven years in Syria. Tune in tonight around 7:15pm to raise awareness.

Because DC embraced Obama’s Affordable Care Act, we have one of the strongest health insurance marketplaces, with nearly 97% of residents covered. Relocating HQs for vital agencies – like the BLM, where 95% of staff already work outside the DC region – does not make government work better for Americans. As someone who practiced law, I wish the cases I saw had started with as much evidence as has come forward in this impeachment inquiry. Time to move on to the next steps.

Big News for #DCstatehood! Our bill in the Senate (S. 631) just received its 35th cosponsor – Senator @RonWyden of Oregon. Thank you, Senator Wyden! My thanks as well to @SenatorCarper for continuing his push for #DCstatehood in the Senate. On to House passage!
Continuing to build momentum inside and outside Congress as we prepare for historic committee and floor votes on HR 51!

Almost there! Our #DCstatehood bill now has a record 223 cosponsors, more than needed for House passage, and endorsements from 106 national groups to help in the Senate. https://www.washingtontimes.com/news/2019/nov/6/dc-officials-activists-ramp-statehood-push/ …

Many thanks to the 79 national organizations of the Clean Budget Coalition for calling on Congress to respect home rule in the DC appropriation bill. DC residents deserve full self-government. #HandsOffDC
